content.description: In the gas-phase reaction represented by the following equation, methane <math alttext="(C H 4)" display="inline" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mpadded><mo>(</mo><mpadded><msub><mi>CH</mi><mn>4</mn></msub></mpadded><mo>)</mo></mpadded></math> and water <math alttext="(H 2 O)" display="inline" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mpadded><mo>(</mo><mpadded><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">H</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mi mathvariant="normal">O</mi></mpadded><mo>)</mo></mpadded></math> are produced from carbon dioxide <math alttext="(C O 2)" display="inline" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mpadded><mo>(</mo><mpadded><msub><mi>CO</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></mpadded><mo>)</mo></mpadded></math> and hydrogen <math alttext="(H 2)" display="inline" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mpadded><mo>(</mo><mpadded><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">H</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></mpadded><mo>)</mo></mpadded></math> at high temperature and pressure.
content.question:
Which of the following identifies the hybridization of the valence orbitals of the central atoms of the methane and water molecules?
<math alttext="C H 4" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>CH</mi><mn>4</mn></msub></math><math alttext="H 2 O" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">H</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mi mathvariant="normal">O</mi></math>A<math alttext="s p 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>s</mi><msup><mi>p</mi><mn>2</mn></msup></math><math alttext="s p" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>s</mi><mi>p</mi></math>B<math alttext="s p 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>s</mi><msup><mi>p</mi><mn>2</mn></msup></math><math alttext="s p 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>s</mi><msup><mi>p</mi><mn>2</mn></msup></math>C<math alttext="s p 3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>s</mi><msup><mi>p</mi><mn>3</mn></msup></math><math alttext="s p 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>s</mi><msup><mi>p</mi><mn>2</mn></msup></math>D<math alttext="s p 3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>s</mi><msup><mi>p</mi><mn>3</mn></msup></math><math alttext="s p 3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>s</mi><msup><mi>p</mi><mn>3</mn></msup></math>

skill.text: 1.A: Describe the components of and quantitative information from models and representations that illustrate particulate-level properties only.
